sentence.text: Also as pro-angiogenic inducer, the role of activation of innate immune response in different redox states has never been defined in tumour angiogenesis.
Functional inhibition of activation of innate immune response and its receptors abrogated HMGB1-induced angiogenic properties of ECs co-cultured with tumour cells.

activation of innate immune response orchestrates the key events of tumour angiogenesis, migration of ECs and their induction to secrete negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II, by adopting distinct redox states.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
